alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:06AM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Kershaw, Lancaster and Fairfield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 97.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue rising to 102.1 feet Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Residents and those with interests near Lake Wateree should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
